message: Hello Bob, I'm excited to discuss the sale of this valuable product with you. I believe it's a great opportunity for you to acquire something that will bring significant value to your business. As we start our negotiation, I'd like to make an initial offer of $18,000 for the product.
Alice, while I appreciate your offer, $18,000 is a bit higher than my budget allows. I'm willing to pay $13,000 for the product, which I believe is a fair price for both of us.

Thank you for your offer, Bob. I understand that $18,000 might be a stretch for you, but I'm still looking to get a good price for the product. I'm willing to meet you halfway and make a counteroffer of $16,500. I believe this is a fair compromise that takes into account your budget and the value the product brings to your business.

Alice, while I appreciate you meeting me halfway, $16,500 is still a bit higher than I'm comfortable with. I'm sticking with my previous offer of $13,000. This is the absolute highest I'm willing to go, and it's a fair price considering the value of the product.

I understand that you're sticking to your original offer, Bob, but I'm still not willing to sell the product for $13,000. I'm willing to make another counteroffer, considering the value the product brings to your business. I'm willing to sell the product for $14,800. This is my final offer, and I'm hoping we can come to an agreement.

Alice, while I appreciate your willingness to negotiate, $14,800 is still more than I'm comfortable spending.  I'm going to stick with my original offer of $13,000. This is a fair price, and I believe it's the best we can do to reach an agreement.

I understand that you're sticking to your original offer, Bob, but I'm still not willing to sell the product for $13,000. I'm willing to make another counteroffer, considering the value the product brings to your business. I'm willing to sell the product for $14,200. This is my final offer, and I'm hoping we can come to an agreement.
